newsitem.title: UK: TransCo sells weekend gas on flexibility mechanism.
newsitem.headline: TransCo sells weekend gas on flexibility mechanism.

text.p: Britain's National Transmission System (NTS), the gas pipeline grid operated by British Gas plc's transportation arm TransCo, sold five lots of gas over the weekend, TransCo said on Monday.

Trading on the "flexibility mechanism", a market instrument designed to keep the NTS in balance, TransCo sold five tranches of gas on the gas day of September 29. This runs from 06.00 on Sept 29 to 06.00 on Sept 30.
TransCo said there were four "system sells" at 0.3835 pence a kiloWatt hour (around 11.24 pence a therm), 0.3836 p/kWh, 0.4090 p/kW/h and 0.4095 p/kWh (around 12.00 p/therm).
These four sales totalled 28,822,986 kiloWatt hours, TransCo said. There was one further sale of just under 700,000 kWh at 0.4094 p/kWh, TransCo added.
A spokeswoman for TransCo added that trade on the flexibility mechanism was muted and that the start of the new gas year on October 1 had made no apparent difference to activity over the weekend.
